metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14122 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
unrar 0.0.1 (aka unrar-free or unrar-gpl) suffers from a stack-based buffer over-read in unrarlib.c, related to ExtrFile and stricomp. It was discovered that UnRAR mishandled specially crafted RAR archive. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly leak sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

unrar-free - 1:0.0.1+cvs20071127-2+deb7u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: unrar-free package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:0.0.1+cvs20071127-2+deb7u1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
